result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Steller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Serve 155 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 12-15-2014 at 6:00 p.m. with work release privileges.  Credit for 3 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Steller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David J. Steller in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of elements of amended charge/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  State moves to dismiss inattentive driving & operating left of center.  14TR199 & 200 are dismissed.   PLQ/WRF filed with the Court & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Assess fine/costs of $3976; 155 days in the PCJ with credit for 3 days com. 12/15 @ 6:00 p.m. with work release.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant David J. Steller in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to Resisting an Officer 946.41(1) Wis. Stats., Class A misdemeanor.  Negotiations, defendant will plead guilty with joint recommendation same as OWI 3rd of $3976 fine/costs; 155 days jail.  Upon motion of State, amend 14CF18 to Resisting an Officer under 946.41(1).

Adjourned initial appearance on November 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant David J. Steller in court with attorney Allan L. Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan requests a PLEA/SENT date mid Nov.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 22, 2014 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
No possession or consumption of alcohol; 
No entrance into bars or taverns.

Defendant David J. Steller in court, in custody, with attorney Allan L Morgan.   Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $2000 Sign. Bond with alcohol monitor component.  Atty Morgan informs the court the problem with alcohol monitor is cost,  No drink, no bars.  Court sets $2000 Sign. Bond with condition no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns.  Defendant waives times limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
